solution_line_template: On Monday, Steve was paid {monday_pounds} * {pay_per_pound} = <<{monday_pounds}*{pay_per_pound}={monday_earnings}>>{monday_earnings} dollars
The {tuesday_pounds} pounds Steve picked on Tuesday gave him {tuesday_pounds} * {pay_per_pound} = <<{tuesday_pounds}*{pay_per_pound}={tuesday_earnings}>>{tuesday_earnings} dollars

So, the amount Steve earned from the first two days on the job is {monday_earnings} +{tuesday_earnings} = <<{monday_earnings}+{tuesday_earnings}={first_two_days_earnings}>>{first_two_days_earnings} dollars

Since Steve rested on Wednesday, he made {wednesday_earnings} dollars, meaning his earnings were {first_two_days_earnings} + {wednesday_earnings} = <<{first_two_days_earnings}+{wednesday_earnings}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings} dollars
The difference between Steve's earnings and his target is {target_earnings} - {total_earnings} = <<{target_earnings}-{total_earnings}={earnings_difference}>>{earnings_difference} dollars

Since he was paid {pay_per_pound} dollars for each pound of lingonberries, Steve needed to pick {earnings_difference}/{pay_per_pound} = <<{earnings_difference}/{pay_per_pound}={thursday_pounds}>>{thursday_pounds} pounds
